column4: EU fines ethylene cartel Orbia, Clariant, Celanese 260 million euros
column5: BRUSSELS (Reuters) - Eu antitrust regulators on Tuesday fined ethylene companies Orbia, Clariant CLN.S and Celanese CE.N 260 million euros ($295.5 million) for taking part in a cartel while Westlake WLK.N avoided a penalty as it alerted the cartel to the EU.
column6: The European Commission said the four companies took part in a cartel related to purchases on the ethylene merchant market by colluding to buy ethylene at the lowest possible price.
column7: “The four companies in the cartel have colluded and exchanged information on purchasing prices which is illegal,” EU antitrust chief Margrethe Vestager said in a statement.
column8: The EU competition enforcer reduced the fines for the four companies by 10% because admitted to taking part in the cartel. However it also increased the penalties by 10% to avoid under-deterrence of such practices.
